definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Observers under dark skies could see up to 20 meteors per hour.
sentences.chinese: 暗夜裏的觀測者每小時最多可見到20顆流星。

sentences.english: Usually, a system will not be in an eigenstate of whatever observable we are interested in.
sentences.chinese: 通常，無論觀測者如何感興趣一個系統不在特徵態裏。

sentences.english: An observer, looking at the earth from another planet, would be likely to call it Oceanus.
sentences.chinese: 一個觀測者從另一個行星看地球將可能稱其爲海神。

sentences.english: A point on the celestial sphere directly below the observer, diametrically opposite the zenith.
sentences.chinese: 天底天球上，在觀測者垂直向下的一點，與天。

sentences.english: American Association of Variable Star Observers.
The nucleus is estimated to be 460 feet in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 觀測者預測核體直徑約爲460英尺。
